alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:39PM EST until March 15 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Wabash River. .Minor flooding is ongoing along the Wabash river and several tributaries due to 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall that fell Friday March 3rd. Flooding is ongoing along the full length of the Wabash River with the crest near Covington. Flooding along many smaller tributaries that has not already ended will end by Tuesday. Flooding will continue through the end of the week and into next week on lower portion of the Wabash river. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, MARCH 15... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, March 15. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Higher rural roads begin to flood. High water isolates many river cabins. Seep water becomes a problem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Monday /9:00 PM EST Monday/ the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Monday /9:00 PM EST Monday/ was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.2 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 14. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
